tp.pr4.control

Interface GameTypeFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComplicaFactory, Connect4Factory, GravityFactory

    public interface GameTypeFactory
    Interface that collects together the construction methods of the different objects involved in a concrete game. There will be one implementation of this interface for each type of game supported.
    Since:
    Assignment 3

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Player createHumanPlayerAtConsole(java.util.Scanner in)
      Constructs a player responsible for asking the user via the console which command he or she would like to execute.
      Move createMove(int col, int row, Counter colour)
      Constructs a move for a particular game.
      Player createRandomPlayer()
      Constructs a player capable of playing the current game by randomly choosing moves.
      GameRules createRules()
      Constructs the concrete rules of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • createRules

        GameRules createRules()
        Constructs the concrete rules of the game.
        Returns:
        The object that implements the rules of the required game.

      • createMove

        Move createMove(int col,
              int row,
              Counter colour)
        Constructs a move for a particular game. A given implementation may not use all the parameters.
        Parameters:
        col - Column where the counter is to be placed.
        row - Row where the counter is to be placed (not used in C4 or Complica).
        colour - Colour of the counter to be placed.
        Returns:
        Move object capable of executing the move for a given type of game.

      • createHumanPlayerAtConsole

        Player createHumanPlayerAtConsole(java.util.Scanner in)
        Constructs a player responsible for asking the user via the console which command he or she would like to execute.
        Parameters:
        in - Input scanner that the player will use to ask the user.
        Returns:
        Player object that will be used to ask the user for the next command to be executed.

      • createRandomPlayer

        Player createRandomPlayer()
        Constructs a player capable of playing the current game by randomly choosing moves.
        Returns:
        Player object that will play randomly.
